title: Bug 38131: ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: A directory named "subpackage" is created within the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: The compiled class file should be placed in the existing "subpackage" directory, without creating a nested subdirectory.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command "ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java".
